content.title: Upcoming Presentations
description: Your Bar License Is Trapped in the 20th Century. Or Is It? Multi-Jurisdictional Rules & Proposed Changes

Bar license regulations, primarily governed by individual states, were established in a different era. Lawyers typically cannot practice in a state other than where they are licensed without exceptions or reciprocity, which can be cumbersome. Recently, both clients and lawyers have questioned this system, leading to a movement to amend Rule of Professional Conduct 5.5 regarding multi-jurisdictional practice and unauthorized practice of law. Speakers will provide an overview of this movement, discuss how to maximize the mobility of your bar license, address the ethical challenges related to advertising, and predict future developments. This session promises a dynamic discussion with the latest information.
Logic for Lawyers: Crafting Persuasive Legal Arguments

Join Ryan McCarl, author of Elegant Legal Writing, for a webinar on advanced techniques for crafting compelling legal arguments. Using practical examples, we will explore how to break down complex legal issues into manageable subproblems, anticipate judicial concerns, and stake out winning positions. This webinar aims to help attorneys refine their argumentation skills and write more persuasive briefs.
AI in Law: Exploring 30+ Game-Changing Use Cases in 60 Minutes

Join us for a fast-paced webinar exploring the transformative power of generative AI in the legal profession. In just one hour, you'll discover over 30 practical use cases showcasing how AI can revolutionize various aspects of legal work, including research, document management, client interactions, and administrative tasks.

content.title: Recent Recordings
description: Google Advertising: PPC & LSAs – Differences, Do’s, & Don’ts

In this webinar, we delved into the diverse advertising options Google provides for law firms, with a focus on Pay-Per-Click (PPC) ads and Local Services Ads (LSAs). We examined the distinctions between these options, how leveraging one or both can enhance your firm's growth, and the common pitfalls to avoid.
How AI Impacts Small & Solo Firms: Exploring the Potential Benefits & Risks of Incorporating AI Into Practice

Small and solo law firms are increasingly adopting artificial intelligence (AI) to improve efficiency. Thomas Shack, a former Comptroller of Massachusetts, offered a program to explain AI's role in modern legal practice. The session covered AI applications like legal research, document review, and predictive analytics, emphasizing the importance of responsible use to avoid errors. Leveraging AI can keep firms competitive if used wisely.
From Billable Hours to Sustainable Income: The Power of Subscription Models + AI

Artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping how legal services are provided. Mathew Kerbis, known as The Subscription Attorney, delved into the fusion of AI and the subscription model to revolutionize your law practice. Kerbis provides actionable insights into incorporating AI, such as prompt engineering methods, and explores how AI can democratize legal services. He suggested a shift away from the billable hour, highlighting the competitive edge and enhanced profitability that comes with integrating subscription models and AI technologies.
